paper_abstract: We consider the t-improper chromatic number of the Erdos-Renyi random graph G(n,p). The t-improper chromatic number chi(t)(G) is the smallest number of colours needed in a colouring of the vertices in which each colour class induces a subgraph of maximum degree at most t. If t = 0, then this is the usual notion of proper colouring. When the edge probability p is constant, we provide a detailed description of the asymptotic behaviour of chi(t)(G(n,p)) over the range of choices for the growth of t = t(n).
paper_title: The t-Improper Chromatic Number of Random Graphs
